result.execSummary:
The defendant Madison Marie Koepke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent.
Court reads-in and dismisses 14CF309.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation but must petition the Court.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Concurrent with:

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes did not appear, DF ATTY: Jens Hubert Loberg appeared, DF: Madison Marie Koepke appeared from jail.  Court called at 9:20 p.m.  Probation Officer Andersen makes statement.  Ms. Andersen advises the Court the DE will report to Washington County for a Warrant then she will be transported to Grace Place and begin Drug Court.  Attorney Loberg speaks on behalf of the DE.  DE makes statement.  Kathy Famerville from Pierce County will be the DE case worker.  DE will begin MRT the beginning of April.  Court will stay the balance of the DE sentence. Probation review hearing on March 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY:  Jens Hubert Loberg, DF:  Madison Marie Koepke appeared from jail. Includes 14CF309 and 14CF495. ADA Sortedahl recites joint recommendation. State files AMENDED INFO. RE: 14CF495: Court reviews felony conviction consequences and constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties from the AMENDED INFO for counts 1 & 2. Def pleads GUILTY. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of counts 1 AND 2, IN THE AMENDED INFO.  14CF309 is read-in and dismissed for restitition and sentencing purposes. 
Court orders: S/W 3 years probation with conditions for counts 1 & 2 - concurrent: 
- 6 months in St. Croix County Jail. To receive credit since November 19, 2014. No good time. 
- Court costs for counts 1 & 2 counts in 14CF309
- AODA  and follow through with all recommendation and treatment
- Absolute sobriety
- Restitution $0.00, but may change if a request is made. 
- Defendant to participate in MRT program fully and successfully complete.
- No contact with K. Bierl (victim in 14CF309)
- No contact with Kyle Rinde
- Defendant to reside in St. Croix County and to apply for drug court in St. Croix County.
- Fully employed or in school. 
Defendant is advised of right to appeal. 
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation.  Probation review hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Preliminary hearing on November 25, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

*INCLUDES 14CF309 AND 14CF495*
*Defendant to be tested today. (blood)

*Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  

*It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kyle Rinde.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
